did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle:
New York State College of Veterinary Medicine Student Wives papers,
1957-1974

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: New York State College of Veterinary Medicine Student Wives

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Six scrapbooks compiled by the wives of students at the New York State College of Veterinary Medicine from 1957-1974. The group called itself alternately, "Senior Wives," "Student Veterinary Wives," and "JAVMA Auxiliary." JAVMA stands for Junior American Veterinary Medical Association.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Men made up the majority of New York State College of Veterinary Medicine students until the 1980s. The student wives club became less active as more women joined the DVM classes.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Six scrapbooks compiled by the wives of students at the New York State College of Veterinary Medicine from 1957-1974. The group called itself alternately, "Senior Wives," "Student Veterinary Wives," and "JAVMA Auxiliary." JAVMA stands for Junior American Veterinary Medical Association.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Veterinary Medicine.
